subject: Investing
title: Real Estate Syndications
description: A fast breakdown of Real Estate Syndications for builders.

hook.text: Twelve investors pooled $50,000 each to buy a 60-unit apartment building none could afford alone.

buildup.text: A syndication is a group investment led by a sponsor who finds the deal and manages it day to day.

discovery.text: Limited partners contribute capital and receive passive income; the sponsor earns management fees.

twist.text: Sponsors typically take 20â€“30% of profits as 'promote,' even though they put up less cash.

climax.text: Strong syndications deliver 15%+ IRR, but a bad sponsor can wipe out your entire investment.

punchline.text: In syndications, you're investing in the sponsor as much as the building.

quiz.question: Who manages the property day to day in a syndication?
